data.reddit:
• Age - 20

• Sex - Female

• Height - 5ft 8

• Weight - Not exactly sure but definitely overweight

• Race - White British

• Duration of complaint - 1 year and 5 months

• Location - Cervical lymph node on right side of neck

• Existing medical issues - Not sure if any of these are relevant but I’ve been diagnosed with Generalised Anxiety Disorder (inc. really horrific health anxiety) and depression. Also have a history of allergies stress-related IBS.

• Current medications - Citalopram, Cerelle and I’ve just finished a course of antibiotics (Flucloxacillin)

Hi guys

Nearly a year and a half ago I realised I could feel a lymph node one one side of my neck. It feel about 1.5cm at most but does sometimes seem smaller but never fully goes away. It’s not big enough to be visible and moves if I press on either side of it but it’s concerning me because I can feel it with my fingers, it’s not exact soft and squishy, and it isn’t painful as it would be if I had an infection. 

I went to the doctors about it when I first found it and they didn’t seem that concerned but then again I had just had a cold so I think they chalked it up to that. However it’s still there over a year later. 

In the past year I’ve had blood tests for unrelated things which have come back perfect so I’ve been telling myself that if I had lymphoma something would have shown on my blood tests, the node would have grown more by now and I’d have more symptoms. Nonetheless my anxiety is driving me insane about it but I’ve got myself into such a state that I’m too scared to even go to the doctors for fear of the worst. 

Does my lymph node sound like something I should be getting this stressed out about? Can lymph nodes swell in response to an infection but then stay permanently swollen? Is my lymph node even swollen or is it a normal size and I’m just being paranoid? 

I know I’d be better off asking these questions to my GP but in my current state of mind I don’t think I could emotionally cope with going to the doctors.

UPDATE FOR ANYONE WITH SIMILAR SYMPTOMS:

I eventually went to a walk-in centre where a nurse told me to go to the GP and ask for an ultrasound. 

I did go to the GP and he had a prod and a poke and basically said that he’s certain it’s just a reactive lymph node that came up after a bout of illness and never went away. 

He wasn’t concerned enough to bother referring me for an ultrasound so I guess I didn’t need to stress out so much after all.
